validate_certificate.loss_exp_decrease(env, exp_certificate, V_state, V_params, x, u, noise_key, probability_bound)[source]

Compute expected decrease condition

Parameters:

  • env – Environment.

  • exp_certificate – True if logRASM is used.

  • V_state – Certificate neural network.

  • V_params – Certificate neural network parameters.

  • x – State.

  • u – Control input.

  • noise_key – Key of the random number generator.

  • probability_bound – The probability bound of the specification that we aim to certify.

Returns:

Expected decrease

validate_certificate.loss_exp_decrease_vmap(env, exp_certificate, V_state, V_params, x, u, noise_key, probability_bound)

Vectorized version of loss_exp_decrease. Takes similar arguments as loss_exp_decrease but with additional array axes over which loss_exp_decrease is mapped.

Original documentation:

Compute expected decrease condition

param env:

Environment.

param exp_certificate:

True if logRASM is used.

param V_state:

Certificate neural network.

param V_params:

Certificate neural network parameters.

param x:

State.

param u:

Control input.

param noise_key:

Key of the random number generator.

param probability_bound:

The probability bound of the specification that we aim to certify.

return:

Expected decrease

validate_certificate.validate_RASM(checkpoint_path, cell_width=0.01, batch_size=10000, forward_pass_batch_size=1000000, expected_decrease_samples=100, seed=1, num_traces=1000, plot_RASM=False, plot_latex_text=True, validate_conditions=True)[source]

Validate the given (log)RASM by discretizing the state space and computing the expected decrease condition empirically.

Parameters:

  • checkpoint_path – Path to load checkpoint from.

  • cell_width – Discretization cell width.

  • batch_size – Batch size to use for computing the expected decrease condition.

  • forward_pass_batch_size – Batch size to use for forward passes.

  • expected_decrease_samples – Number of samples to use for computing the expected decrease condition in each grid point.

  • seed – Random seed.

  • num_traces – Number of Monte Carlo simulations to run.

  • plot_RASM – If True, plot the (log)RASM.

  • plot_latex_text – If True, use LaTeX for plotting.

  • validate_conditions – If True, validate the certificate conditions empirically.

validate_certificate.validate_all(args, final_ckpt_name)[source]

Validate all learned certificates stored in the output folder (which contain the given prefix)
